page.title: 03Tourism - Poldark Mine
page.content: Poldark mine was a prosperous tin mine in the 1730s. The whole family worked at the mine. The men who worked down the mine earned Â£1.40, the women who hammered the tin to pieces earned 37p and the girls a bit less and the boys who pushed wheelbarrows full of tin earned 25p a month. The mine stopped working because of money problems and was found again when Mr Young (the owner) had workmen digging a place for a compressor. They started digging a pit because they thought that it wouldn't make as much noise if it was put in a pit. When they were digging they suddenly found the shaft and Mr Young decided he would dig it out. When it was dug out he decided to open it to the public and now you can go down through the mine, which is very interesting.
